pageContext.claim: “They go into our country, and then you announce -- these are the laws -- then you say, 'Come back in three years for your trial.' Tell me, what percentage of people come back? Would you say 100 percent? No, you're a little off. Like, how about 2 percent? And those people, you almost don't want, because they cannot be very smart. Two percent. Two percent. Two percent come back. Those two percent are not going to make America great again, that I can tell you.  Crazy.”
pageContext.analysis: According to our friends at Politifact, "around 60-75 percent of non-detained migrants have attended their immigration court proceedings, according to Justice Department data."
